doc:
Dorothy Hall (actress) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dorothy_Hall_(actress) 0 Dorothy Hall (December 3, 1906 – February 2, 1953) was an American film actress in the late 1920s and early 1930s. She began her career as an actress on Broadway and transitioned fully into film acting in the late 1920s. She had small roles in films such as The Winning Oar (1927) and The Broadway Drifter (1927) and was later featured in the Vitaphone short In the Nick of Time (1929) and The Laughing Lady (1929). Her final and best known film role was in Dorothy Arzner's Working Girls (1931) where she plays Mae Thorpe. Dorothy Hall died on February 2, 1953 in New York City. Dorothy_Hall ( December_3_,_1906 – February_2_,_1953 ) was an_American_film_actress in the_late_1920s and early_1930s . She began her_career as an_actress on Broadway and transitioned fully into film_acting in the_late_1920s . She had small_roles in films such_as The_Winning_Oar_(_1927_) and The_Broadway_Drifter_(_1927_) and was_later_featured in the_Vitaphone_short In the_Nick of Time_(_1929_) and The_Laughing_Lady_(_1929_) . Her_final_and_best_known_film_role was in Dorothy_Arzner 's_Working_Girls ( 1931_) where she plays Mae_Thorpe . Dorothy_Hall died on February_2_,_1953 in New_York_City .
